safe.name: Acetaminophen (Paracetamol)
commonBrands: Tylenol Cold & Flu (acetaminophen component in combos)
safe.notes: Pain/fever reliever. Avoid duplicate acetaminophen across combo products; watch total daily dose.

safe.name: Dextromethorphan
safe.notes: Cough suppressant. Often combined with other ingredients; check combo safety.

safe.name: Guaifenesin
safe.notes: Expectorant to loosen mucus. Often combined with dextromethorphan or decongestants.

safe.name: Loratadine
safe.notes: Non-drowsy antihistamine for allergies. Often considered safer than first-generation sedating antihistamines in many patients.

safe.name: Cetirizine
safe.notes: Second-generation antihistamine for allergies. Mild sedation possible in some people.

safe.name: Calcium Carbonate
safe.notes: Antacid for heartburn. May affect absorption of some medications; separate doses as advised.

safe.name: Aluminum / Magnesium Hydroxide + Simethicone
safe.notes: Antacid and anti-gas combination. Check for other conditions (kidney disease) with provider.

safe.name: Simethicone
safe.notes: Relieves gas and bloating. Minimal systemic absorption.

safe.name: Saline Nasal Spray
safe.notes: Non-medicated nasal saline for congestion and dryness. Typically very safe.

safe.name: Topical Menthol / Camphor Rub
safe.notes: Topical chest rubs for cough/congestion relief. Avoid ingestion; follow label directions.

avoid.name: Acetylsalicylic Acid (Aspirin)
avoid.notes: AVOID — salicylate. Found alone and in many combination headache, cold, and pain products.

avoid.name: Ibuprofen
avoid.notes: Non-steroidal anti-inflammatory drug (NSAID). Avoid if instructed to avoid NSAIDs (e.g., some kidney, GI, cardiac, or pregnancy situations).

avoid.name: Naproxen
avoid.notes: NSAID. Similar cautions as ibuprofen; avoid if told to avoid NSAIDs.

avoid.name: Diclofenac (Oral)
avoid.notes: Oral NSAID formulation. Avoid if NSAIDs are contraindicated. Topical diclofenac gel may be handled differently—verify separately.

avoid.name: Pseudoephedrine
avoid.notes: Systemic decongestant. Often avoided in certain heart conditions, hypertension, pregnancy, or other specific situations.

avoid.name: Phenylephrine (Systemic)
avoid.notes: Systemic decongestant similar concerns as pseudoephedrine; avoid if instructed. Nasal sprays with phenylephrine may have different risk profiles.

avoid.name: First-Generation Sedating Antihistamines
avoid.notes: Sedating antihistamines. Often avoided in many patients due to drowsiness, confusion risk, and other side effects—especially in older adults or certain conditions.

avoid.name: Combination NSAID + Acetaminophen Products
avoid.notes: Avoid if NSAIDs are contraindicated, even if acetaminophen is safe.

combos.name: DayQuil Cold & Flu (typical)
combos.notes: Common daytime cold/flu product. Check safety of decongestant component (phenylephrine) and watch total acetaminophen dose.

combos.name: NyQuil Cold & Flu (typical)
combos.notes: Nighttime cold/flu product. Contains sedating antihistamine (doxylamine); avoid if first-generation antihistamines are not recommended.

combos.name: NeoCitran Cold & Flu (Hot Drink)
combos.notes: Hot drink cold/flu remedy. Contains decongestant and antihistamine; check both components for safety.

combos.name: Excedrin Extra Strength (typical)
combos.notes: Migraine/headache combo with aspirin (salicylate). Avoid if aspirin/salicylates are contraindicated.

combos.name: Reactine Allergy + Sinus
combos.notes: Second-generation antihistamine plus decongestant. Check pseudoephedrine risks.

combos.name: Tylenol Cold & Sinus (typical)
combos.notes: Acetaminophen plus systemic decongestant. Evaluate decongestant safety and total acetaminophen.

combos.name: Tylenol Complete Cold, Cough & Flu (typical)
combos.notes: Multi-symptom product. Check decongestant suitability and avoid duplicate acetaminophen.
